newsitem.title: BELGIUM: AVIS EUROPE FULL-YEAR PROFIT TO JUMP.
newsitem.headline: AVIS EUROPE FULL-YEAR PROFIT TO JUMP.

text.p: Car rental rental company Avis Europe is likely to post full-year consolidated net profit of 50 million ecus (40 million pounds) compared with 15 million ecus, its Belgian parent company said on Thursday.
Avis Europe's bookyear ran until February 28, 1996.
Avis Europe's forecast was based on results for the first 11 months and an estimate for this month.

Avis Europe, 77.1 percent held by leading Belgian car importer and distributor D'Ieteren , said earlier this year it wanted to list part of its capital on the London share market, which should raise about 250 million pounds.
The London Stock Exchange is due to approve the prospectus on Friday.

Avis Europe deputy chairman and D'Ieteren executive vice-president Gilbert van Marcke told a news conference the proceeds of the listing would be used to pay off debts, invest in development of rental activities and buy back General Motors (GM) stake in Avis Europe.
GM has a 14.2 percent in Avis Europe, Avis Inc 8.7 percent.
D'Ieteren said it planned to remain the majority shareholder in Avis Europe after its listing.

"Apart from the planned operation, Avis Europe will buy back entirely the 8.7 percent stake now held by Avis Inc and acquire a 40-year licence to operate the Avis system in Asia in exchange for the payment of royalties," D'Ieteren said.
Van Marcke was confident the car rental market would grow further due to low interest rates, economic growth in Europe, expanding tourism and air travel.
In addition, Avis Europe also sees expansion in Central and Eastern Europe and in Asia.
Van Marcke added that future projects could include the launch of Avis activities in countries like India or China.
